IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To provide an excellent liberal arts education in a distinctively Christian environment.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To provide an excellent liberal arts education in a distinctively Christian environment, thus preparing students for both personal and career effectiveness.
IRS990.Desc: Instruction: Hannibal-LaGrange University (HLGU) provides a diverse range of academic programs including 36 baccalaureate degrees, three associate degrees, one certificate program, and six graduate degrees. The university offers degrees in various fields such as Christian Ministry, Psychology, Theater, Education, Nursing, and the Sciences. HLGU offers a robust liberal arts education through its core curriculum that seamlessly integrates various academic disciplines. Additionally, the university provides master's degrees in Education and Leadership.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: At Hannibal-LaGrange University, students have access to a comprehensive range of services designed to enrich their educational experience. These services include career planning and placement, counseling, financial aid, a diverse range of athletic programs for both men and women, intramural and club sports programs, and an array of student activities. The university also offers theater programs, concerts, and a variety of campus ministry programs, including ministry teams, international missions, and service experience opportunities. These services align with HLGU's mission statement, which emphasizes the university's commitment to positively impacting lives and communities through relevant education that is anchored in a Biblical worldview.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Hannibal-LaGrange University provides residential facilities for approximately 550 students. The university offers an array of living options, ranging from community-style dormitories to private bedrooms. Fresh Ideas, the university's dining services, provide meals to students and run a sandwich and coffee shop on campus. Additionally, the Student Life Center houses the Campus Store, which is managed by our Campus Store Manager.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: VP Enroll. Mgmt and Mktg (part year)

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: The organization is a school as described under 170(b)(1)(A)(ii) and is not required to complete a public support schedule. Schedule A, Part II is completed to verify the School can qualify under public charity status section 170(b)(1)(A)(vi) and, therefore, qualifies to use the first listed special rule for Schedule B reporting.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: Endowment Held in Trust by Others

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Deposits held in custody represent fundraised monies used to offset clubs and/or sports teams activities not funded by the general budget. The University is the custodian of the funds and has ultimate control. If the club ceases to exist, the University has the authority to absorb the balance. These funds are unrestricted in nature and the University has full control of them.

Income from endowment funds with donor restrictions is used for scholarships, athletic programs, and general operating, as allowed by the donor. Quasi-endowments are designated by the board to be held in perpetuity with income for general operating expenses as deemed appropriate by the board. Part V, Line 1a, column (e) - Beginning balance: The beginning balance has been adjusted to not include endowments held in trust by others totaling $847,748 as determined during the financial statement audit.
Change in value of beneficial interest -265,572. Fundraising Event Expenses 21,576.
Scholarships 5,848,376.
Fundraising Event Expenses 21,576.
Scholarships 5,848,376.
The racially nondiscriminatory policy is publicized through television, radio, and newspaper ads.
The University received financial assistance from the Higher Education Emergency Relief Funds (HEERF) and the Paycheck Protection Program as part of the CARES Act.

All student awards are maintained in the university's financial aid software system. Federal awards are based on financial and other data provided by the student and verified, as appropriate, by the university. Federal awards are subject to an annual audit based on standards found in the uniform guidance and performed by an independent auditor. Selection criteria for donor-funded scholarships are mostly determined by the donor and is available in the financial aid office. Selection criteria for federal and state aid is also found in the financial aid office and available to the public on the internet.

Pursuant to Internal Revenue Code Section 107, ministerial housing allowances are provided for qualifying ministerial employees. This is not included in taxable compensation. Dr. Anthony Allen and Robert Matz met the qualifications for and received a ministerial housing allowance during the tax year.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: Family member of Vinita Henry, Trustee

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The number of contributions represent the number of contributions received, not the number of items donated.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 1a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee is composed of nine (9) members and composed of the officers of the Board and the Chairpersons of the Standing Committees. No more than one-third (1/3) of the Executive Committee members may reside outside of the State of Missouri. The officers of the Board serve as the officers of the Executive Committee. The Executive Committee shall meet as needed to conduct the business of the University between regular meetings. The Executive Committee, when the Board is not in session, arranges for the execution of orders and resolutions not otherwise specifically committed or provided. It may temporarily fill vacancies in the faculty occurring between regular meetings or during a recess of the Board, and in accordance with the general policy of the Board, has the care and direction of matters pertaining to the welfare of the University, and especially shall discharge such duties as the Board may assign to it from time to time. It shall make formal reports of its action to the Board at its next regular meeting. Appointments to fill vacancies are subject to confirmation by the Board. The Executive Committee does not act contrary to prior action or direction by the Board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The University has one member. The Member of the University is The Missouri Baptist Convention, a Missouri Chapter 352 non-profit corporation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Missouri Baptist Convention has the sole and exclusive right to elect and remove trustees of the University or any subsidiary.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Missouri Baptist Convention has, in its the sole and absolute discretion, the following right: 1) The right to recommend to the University's Trustees and the right to approve or reject, in writing, any amendment by the University's Trustees of the University's Articles and/or Bylaws; 2) The right to approve or reject the sale, mortgage, lease, pledge, or transfer of all or substantially all of the assets of the University or any subsidiary; 3) The right to approve or reject the creation, amendment, or dissolution of any subsidiary of University; 4) The right to have notice of all meetings of the Board of the University or any subsidiary, to be sent to the Convention's Executive Director; 5) The right to have the Convention's President serve as a non-voting ex officio Trustee of the University's Board; 7) The right to have the Convention's Executive Director to serve as a non-voting ex officio Trustee of the University's Board and as a non-voting ex officio member of any search committee for University's President; 8) The right to have the Convention's President or his designated representative to attend meetings of the Board; and 9) The right to approve or reject any material change by the University in the ministry purposes of University or any subsidiary.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is prepared by an independent CPA firm and reviewed in detail by the organization's top management. The reviewed Form 990 is then provided to the board of directors prior to filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The University requires all officers and board members to annually complete and sign a conflict of interest questionnaire. The Vice President of Finance is responsible for reviewing the signed statements and ensuring that interested persons are in compliance with the conflict of interest policy. The President is responsible for reviewing the signed statement of the Vice President of Finance. Should any potential conflicts of interest be disclosed, the board member or officer would be asked to refrain from participation in any deliberation or decision with regard to matters affected by the relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board determines and sets the President's compensation. Comparability data is used and this process is documented in the board minutes. Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b - The President and the Executive Board determine the compensation of the other officers. Comparability data is used the process is documented in the officer's HR file.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are available upon request.

Compensation reported in Part VII, column D and Schedule J, Part II, column B is the amount reported on the individual's W-2, box 1 or 5 (whichever amount is greater) per the IRS instructions. In the case of minister's compensation when box 5 of the W-2 is not applicable, box 1 compensation is used. Employee deferrals to qualified retirement plans are normally captured in box 5, not box 1 of Form W-2. For reporting purposes we have included the minister's retirement plan deferrals in Part VII, column F and Schedule J, Part II, column C.
Change in value of beneficial interest -265,572.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: The Executive Board of the Missouri Baptist Convention
